text: Nigeria falls below other countries in Africa in terms of voter turnout.

head: In the 2015 national election, turnout varied across the country. PVT estimates of turnout ranged from 85% turnout in Yobe state to 28% in Borno and Lagos states.
text: States in the south saw double-digit decreases in turnout between 2011 and 2015.

head: For state-level elections, turnout is even lower. Since 2015, states that held elections for governor saw well under 50% turnout.
sub: [state outlines of states that have held elections since 2015 with a popup of their turnouts: Kogi: XX%, Anambra: XX%, Ekiti: XX%, Osun: XX%]

head: Declining turnout is concerning. A turnout of approximately 44% in 2015 means that - in a country of then roughly 182 million people - only 29.4 million, or 16% of the population chose the country’s leaders.
